metadata.title: CVE-2023-1073 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A memory corruption flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s human interfacedevice (HID) subsystem in how a user inserts a malicious USB device. Thisflaw allows a local user to crash or potentially escalate their privilegeson the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1073` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-generic - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-241-lowlatency - 4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1163-azure - 4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-241.275~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1119.125').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1163.178~14.04.1').
